bug.author: dmonopoly
bug.summary: How do you generate tensorflow docs so you can confirm documentation fixes you make?
bug.description: Example: Suppose I see a formatting error in a Tensorflow function's arguments on the web. I then make a change in the "Args: ..." section of the function's python comments. How can I generate these html docs after making this fix?

comments.comment: Script seems out of date / didn't work - just made my terminal force close oddly. Anyway, I did find <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/docs_src/community/documentation.md>https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/docs_src/community/documentation.md</denchmark-link> though, which looks like the more official answer.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/dmonopoly>@dmonopoly</denchmark-link> , ah sorry for the confusion. Thanks for finding the right answer.
